input_text:
Job Title: Solutions Architect - Kinaxis

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Information Technology

Description:
Solutions Architect - Supply Chain Service Line
Genpact (NYSE: G) is a global professional services and solutions firm delivering outcomes that shape the future. Our 125,000+ people across 30+ countries are driven by our innate curiosity, entrepreneurial agility, and desire to create lasting value for clients. Powered by our purpose – the relentless pursuit of a world that works better for people – we serve and transform leading enterprises, including the Fortune Global 500, with our deep business and industry knowledge, digital operations services, and expertise in data, technology, and AI. 
Transformation happens here. Come, be a part of our exciting journey! Are you the one we are looking for?
Inviting applications for the role of Solutions Architect - Supply Chain Consulting As a Kinaxis RapidResponse Solution Architect, you’ll work externally with clients to help identify their most pressing supply chain and operational challenges, and internally collaborate with your colleagues to design, develop, deploy, and support solutions. Work on multifaceted projects that demand analytical thinking, creative problem-solving, effective communication, and strong interpersonal skills.
You’ll work with clients to improve their strategies, processes, and operational alignment. Our focus is on technology-enabled business transformation. Projects range from short, multi-week assessments to phased multi-month design and implementations and everything in-between. The variety of projects provides the Solution Architect with a dynamic and highly challenging opportunity to grow and learn.
Your RoleThe Solution Architect is a key member of our implementation team. A leader with deep system implementation experience, you will be the main point of contact between the client and Genpact’s consulting team. You will be involved in driving requirements gathering sessions, developing a solid design, and working with their teammates to execute a smooth implementation. The solution architect's process typically involves recommending the most appropriate technology for the client based on the architect’s expertise.
Typical responsibilities include:Provide the connection between our clients’ strategic business leaders and Genpact’s technical team by clearly communicating business functional issues.Conduct business processes and requirements analysis.Advise clients on key architectural decisions concerning the Kinaxis RapidResponse platform and supporting technologies.Evaluate risks related to requirements management, business process definition, testing processes, internal controls, project communications, training, and organizational change management.Produce technical architectures, develop system requirements, identify resources, and estimate timelines for project completion.Develop client-ready materials related to requirement specification, process analysis, system-based and manual controls, functional design, and test plans.Assist in the scoping of prospective engagements, developing proposals, planning, logistics, and the execution of project management processes.
QualificationsBachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, supply chain management, or other relevant degree; or equivalent work experienceExperience developing, supporting, or implementing Kinaxis RapidResponse required.Experience with functional knowledge in supply chain, demand or supply planning, S&OP, after sales service operations, or transportation managementKnowledge of supply chain systems, processes and data, and business operationsExperience integrating to ERP systems such as SAP and OracleExperience in systems integration and ETL tools, data mapping, and systems integration a plusExceptional drive, good interpersonal skills, and the ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, and to immediately contribute to a team environment.An ability to prioritize and perform well in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining a high level of client focusGood work ethic and high attention to detail, with a desire to learn.
Location and TravelThe nature of our business requires travel to client locations. Travel tends to fluctuate depending on specific project and client needs but typically is in the range of 25-40%.
About USGenpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Genpact is committed to building a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. For more information, visit www.genpact.com. Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and YouTube.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
